channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Traffic Collision with Entrapment; INC#1057; 02:02PM; 13399 W Culver Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41F9zJ9; #DelRey; PRELIM: Three patients total, two of whom remain trapped in the wreckage. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD West Traffic Division (Incident #2362). ; FS 67; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 E205 E226 E51 E67 EM9 HR3 RA43 RA5 T26 T5 UR88; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

COMPLETE - River Rescue; INC#0861; 12:53PM; 15100 W Parthenia St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GUlmtK; #NorthHills; A comprehensive LAFD ground and air search of the location and areas downstream has found no victim(s). The incident is being categorized as a false alarm, and all LAFD units are being made available to handle other emergencies.; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 E275 E39 E7 E81 H3 H4 HA3 HA4 RA7 SC1 SW44 SW88 T75 UR88; CH8; 17 , 18; Brian Humphrey

River Search; INC#0861; 12:18PM; 15100 W Parthenia St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3GUlmtK; #NorthHills; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to one unoccupied and apparently previously damaged and abandoned vehicle discovered (after being washed downstream?) in the narrow, concrete-lined flood control channel that bisects Parthenia Street, just east of Noble Avenue, containing approximately 3 feet of swift moving water. As first arriving responders secure the vehicle, their LAFD colleagues are searching downstream by ground and air out of an abundance of caution, to assure no person was somehow swept downstream, as the channel leads to the much larger and at times treacherous Pacoima Wash.; FS 7; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 E275 E7 E81 H0A H0B RA7 SC1 SW44 SW88 T75 UR88; CH8; 17, 18; Brian Humphrey

Mudslide; INC#0752; 11:16AM; 1515 N Sunset Plaza Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/41Aom88; #HollywoodHills West; PRELIM: LAFD responders have preceded the City's Department of Building & Safety Inspector (Unknown ETA) to assure safety in the rear yard of a 2,800 square-foot single family home, where a portion of upslope hillside has given way, bringing mud and soil onto the patio, possibly damaging or threatening the structure. No injury. No formal evacuation. Media Inquiries: LA City Dept of Building & Safety.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; E227 E41 T27; CH7; Brian Humphrey

Street Closure Flooding; 11:45AM; 7100 Lankershim Blvd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/uRVFpjDyFByA5mjV7; #NorthHollywood; LAFD responders have closed Lankershim Boulevard in both directions between Sherman Way and Vose Street (beneath the railroad bridge - which is NOT impacted) due to that low-lying area being flooded with an unspecified depth of rainwater, stranding one or more vehicles. No injury. No rescues. Media Inquiries: LADOT and Public Works ; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley; Council District 2; None; None; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0630; 10:44AM; 17840 W Lecco Ln; MAP: https://bit.ly/3va3Rmo; #PacificPalisades; 47 LAFD Firefighters took just 50 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish stubborn flames on multiple levels of a three-level 2,844 square foot descending hillside home (built 1993), that was unoccupied at the time of the fire. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC17 BC9 E19 E23 E263 E292 E295 E62 E63 RA37 RA46 RA58 RA837 SO1 T63 T92 T95; CH9; 12, 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0630; 09:54AM; 17840 W Lecco Ln; MAP: https://bit.ly/3va3Rmo; #PacificPalisades; PRELIM: Offensive fire attack against flames within the rear portion of a 2,844 square foot descending hillside home.; FS 23; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC17 BC9 E19 E23 E263 E292 E63 RA37 RA837 T63 T92; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0574; 09:52AM; 1616 E Pennsylvania Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TsUw3g; #BoyleHeights; 38 LAFD Firefighters took just 23 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish an outside fire to the rear of a two-story *residential triplex* (conversion) that extended to the attic of the 1,956 square foot structure (built 1900). No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E2 E202 E203 E447 E458 RA2 RA25 SO1 SQ21 T2 T3; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0574; 09:29AM; 1616 E Pennsylvania Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TsUw3g; #BoyleHeights; PRELIM: Outside fire to the rear of a two-story home has extended to the attic of the structure.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E2 E202 E203 E447 E458 RA2 RA25 SQ21 T2 T3; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Complete - Rescue ; INC#1660; 09:00PM; 701 E New Dock St; MAP: https://bit.ly/47cZkg9; #SanPedro; The adult male stranded inside the compact elevator of a dockside crane approximately 60' above ground, proved to be an elevator mechanic working on the system - and not the crane operator. LAFD responders, including those specially trained, certified and equipped to perform specialized urban search and rescue, climbed the exterior of the rain-drenched crane to a location between levels (i.e. elevator landings), where they stabilized the elevator and forced open the elevator doors. The stranded worker was medically assessed inside the small elevator (to confirm no illness or injury), before being placed into a rope and harness system to be lowered outside the elevator shaft to the next landing. He was then removed from the harness and walked down an auxiliary stairwell with firefighter assistance to ground level. He has declined any further medical care or transportation. ; FS 40; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 BC6 BT17 BT2 BT3 E238 E285 E40 E49 E5 E85 EM11 HR3 RA27 RA36 RA827 RA85 T38 T85 UR5 UR85 UR88; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey
